flavor: When war machines became too costly, Tawnos's weaponry replaced them.

name: Terror
text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

name: The Brute
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+0.\n{R}{R}{R}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
flavor: After years of being bullied, Fergo reaped the benefits of his newfound strength: he never met a man he didn't want to fight.

name: The Hive
text: {5}, {T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp onto the battlefield. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: Mouths and wings beyond numbering, but a single mind to guide them.

name: The Wretched
text: At end of combat, gain control of all creatures blocking The Wretched for as long as you control The Wretched.
flavor: Once I had the strength but no wisdom; now I have the wisdom but no strength.\n—Persian proverb

name: Thicket Basilisk
text: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
flavor: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the basilisk's terrible power.

name: Throne of Bone
text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

name: Thrull Retainer
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+1.\nSacrifice Thrull Retainer: Regenerate enchanted creature.
flavor: "Until the Rebellion, thrulls served their masters faithfully—even at the cost of their own lives."\n—Sarpadian Empires, vol. II

name: Time Bomb
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a time counter on Time Bomb.\n{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Time Bomb: Time Bomb deals damage equal to the number of time counters on it to each creature and each player.

name: Time Elemental
text: When Time Elemental attacks or blocks, at end of combat, sacrifice it and it deals 5 damage to you.\n{2}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent that isn't enchanted to its owner's hand.

name: Titania's Song
text: Each noncreature artifact loses all abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

name: Torture
text: Enchant creature\n{1}{B}: Put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.
flavor: "It helps pass the time until you die."\n—Grandmother Sengir

name: Touch of Death
text: Touch of Death deals 1 damage to target player. You gain 1 life.\nDraw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor: "What was yours is mine. Your land, your people, and now your life."\n—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

name: Tranquility
text: Destroy all enchantments.

name: Truce
text: Each player may draw up to two cards. For each card less than two a player draws this way, that player gains 2 life.
flavor: Not all victories require defeat.\n—Onean idiom

name: Tsunami
text: Destroy all Islands.

name: Tundra Wolves
text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains.

name: Twiddle
text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

name: Underground River
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Underground River deals 1 damage to you.

name: Unholy Strength
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+1.

name: Unstable Mutation
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +3/+3.\nAt the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

name: Unsummon
text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

name: Untamed Wilds
text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Updraft
text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.\nDraw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor: "Come one, come all! this rock shall fly From its firm base as soon as I."\n—Sir Walter Scott, "The Lady of the Lake"

name: Urza's Avenger
text: {0}: Urza's Avenger gets -1/-1 and gains your choice of banding, flying, first strike, or trample until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
flavor: Unable to settle on just one design, Urza decided to create one versatile being.

name: Urza's Bauble
text: {T}, Sacrifice Urza's Bauble: Look at a card at random in target player's hand. You draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

name: Urza's Mine
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {C}{C} to your mana pool instead.
flavor: Mines became common as cities during the days of the artificers.

name: Urza's Power Plant
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {C}{C} to your mana pool instead.
flavor: Artifact construction required immense resources.

name: Urza's Tower
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool instead.
flavor: Urza always put Tocasia's lessons on resource-gathering to effective use.

name: Vampire Bats
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\n{B}: Vampire Bats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
flavor: "For something is amiss or out of place / When mice with wings can wear a human face."\n—Theodore Roethke, "The Bat"

name: Venom
text: Enchant creature\nWhenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy the other creature at end of combat.
flavor: "I told him it was just a flesh wound, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone."\n—Maeveen O'Donagh,\nMemoirs of a Soldier

name: Verduran Enchantress
text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
flavor: "Weave the magic so that it sings to you, and will always fly home . . . ."\n—Verduran teaching

name: Vodalian Soldiers
flavor: "Vodalian rank is displayed by the colors and patterns of their skin. Beware the color red; that is the badge of the empress's favor."\n—Corbio, pearl diver

name: Wall of Air
text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: When no falcons fly, beware the sky.\n—Femeref aphorism

name: Wall of Bone
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\n{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor: "Good neighbors make good walls."\n—Jakkarak the Maimer

name: Wall of Brambles
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\n{G}: Regenerate Wall of Brambles.
flavor: Sleeping in brambles\n—Elven phrase meaning\n"plagued by guilt"

name: Wall of Fire
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\n{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: "Struggle, and you will only fan the flames."\n—Talibah, embermage

name: Wall of Spears
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\nFirst strike
flavor: Even the most conservative generals revised their tactics after the Battle of Sarinth, during which a handful of peasant-pikemen held off a trio of rampaging craw wurms.

name: Wall of Stone
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
flavor: The ground itself lends its strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.

name: Wall of Swords
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\nFlying
flavor: Just as the evil ones approached to slay Justina, she cast a great spell, imbuing her weapons with her own life force. Thus she fulfilled the prophecy: "In the death of your savior will you find salvation."

name: Wanderlust
text: Enchant creature\nAt the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to that player.
flavor: "How terrible to wander wishing only to escape oneself."\n—Taysir

name: War Mammoth
text: Trample
flavor: I didn't think mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.

name: Warp Artifact
text: Enchant artifact\nAt the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.

name: Weakness
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets -2/-1.

name: Whirling Dervish
text: Protection from black\nAt the beginning of each end step, if Whirling Dervish dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

name: White Knight
text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)\nProtection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)
flavor: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the knight had just laid waste.

name: Wild Growth
text: Enchant land\nWhenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

name: Wind Spirit
text: Flying\nMenace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor: " . . . When the trees bow down their heads, / The wind is passing by."\n—Christina Rossetti,\n"Who Has Seen the Wind?"

name: Winds of Change
text: Each player shuffles the cards from his or her hand into his or her library, then draws that many cards.
flavor: "'Tis the set of sails, and not the gales, Which tell us the way to go."\n—Ella Wheeler Wilcox, "Winds of Fate"

name: Winter Blast
text: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.
flavor: "Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!" —William Shakespeare, King Lear

flavor:
"When once winter has ahold,
Not willingly does she withdraw
her icy touch, wistfully caressing—
The deepened air sleeps its cold."
—Aline Corralurn, "Late Thaw"

name: Wolverine Pack
text: Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
flavor: "Give them great meals of beef and iron and steel, they will eat like wolves and fight like devils."\n—William Shakespeare, King Henry V

name: Wooden Sphere
text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

text: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated. Word of Blasting deals damage equal to that Wall's converted mana cost to the Wall's controller.
flavor: "Walls? What walls?"\n—Jaya Ballard, task mage

name: Wrath of God
text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

name: Wyluli Wolf
text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "When one wolf calls, others follow.\nWho wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?"\n—Maimun al-Wyluli, diary

name: Zephyr Falcon
text: Flying, vigilance
